trans-unit.source: Represents a base class for design-time tools, not derived from <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner"></xref>, that provide smart tag or designer verb capabilities.

The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner> class provides the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.ActionLists%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.Verbs%2A> properties to query for the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerVerb> collections, respectively.

However, if a design-time tool author decides not to derive from this class, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet> class represents an alternative base class to provide this functionality.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet> class contains only three members, described in the following table.
Public member
Description
Returns the collection of either the smart tags or designer verbs associated with the designed component.
The base implementation returns `null`.
Gets the collection of all the smart tags associated with the designed component.
The base implementation simply calls <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet.GetCommands%2A>.
Gets the collection of all the designer verbs associated with the designed component.
The base implementation simply calls <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet.GetCommands%2A>.
A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet> should be added as a site-specific service.
Externally, a service of this type should first be queried to discover smart tag and designer verb functionality.
If this service is not found, then the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesigner.Verbs%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property should be used instead.
This procedure provides a path for backwards compatibility.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet"></xref> class.
Because this base class contains no state, the default constructor does nothing.
Gets the collection of all the smart tags associated with the designed component.
The base implementation simply calls <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet.GetCommands%2A> with the string parameter "ActionLists".
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> that contains the smart tags for the associated designed component.
Returns a collection of command objects.
Although the base implementation always returns `null`, the overridden version supplied by the programmer should return a collection of command objects of the type described by `name`.

The base implementation of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet.Verbs%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet.ActionLists%2A> properties specify the following values and meanings for this parameter.
String
Meaning
"ActionLists"
Return a collection of all the smart tags associated with the component.
"Verbs"
Return a collection of all the designer verbs associated with the component.

The type of collection to return, indicating either a <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> or a <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerVerbCollection"></xref>.

A collection that contains the specified type—either <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> or <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerVerb"></xref>—of command objects.
The base implementation always returns `null`.
Gets the collection of all the designer verbs associated with the designed component.
The base implementation simply calls <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerCommandSet.GetCommands%2A> with the string parameter "Verbs".
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerVerbCollection"></xref> that contains the designer verbs for the associated designed component.
